text:
Hi! This might seem silly (newb here), but how do you guys run a julia script from the terminal? I understand the precompilation stuff in the REPL and that it is faster when run the next time but say I have a file `demo.jl` and run it from the terminal with `julia demo.jl`, it takes the same amount of time it would take when precompiling. So, in this case, I have to wait for a good amount of time before I see some output. Would be glad if someone could shed some light on this. Thanks.

This is unlike python, where simply running `python demo.py` would render the output regardless of the REPL or terminal environment.
EDIT: Added context through python example.
